content:
[Ag(NO 2 )(L)]. A methanol solution (6 mL) of L (43 mg, 0.20 mmol) was slowly diffused into an aqueous solution (6 mL) of AgNO2 (30 mg, 0.20 mmol). Colorless crystals of [Ag(NO2)(L)] formed at the interface, and were obtained in 6 days in 70% yield. Mp:  164 °C dec. Anal. Calcd for C12H14N3O2SiAg:  C, 39.14; H, 3.83; N, 11.41. Found:  C, 40.04; H, 3,77; N, 11.14. IR (KBr, cm-1):  ν(NO2), 1254 (s).

[Ag 2 (L) 3 ](CF 3 SO 3 ) 2 . A methanol solution of L was slowly diffused into an aqueous solution of AgCF3SO3 in a mole ratio of 1:1. Yield: 70% based on Ag(I) salt. Mp:  252 °C dec. Anal. Calcd for C38H42N6O6F6S2Si3Ag2:  C, 39.45; H, 3.66; N, 7.26. Found:  C, 40.01; H, 3,76; N, 7.24. The crystals were obtained as a methanol solvate, but the elemental analysis was accomplished after desolvation under vacuum. IR (KBr, cm-1):  ν(CF3SO3), 814 (s).

[Ag(L) 2 ](PF 6 ). This reaction was carried out by a similar method using acetone instead of methanol as a solvent. Yield:  70%. Mp:  210 °C dec. Anal. Calcd for C24H28N4PF6Si2Ag:  C, 42.40; H, 4.14; N, 8.22. Found:  C, 42.30; H, 4.18; N, 8.48. IR (KBr, cm-1):  ν(PF6), 838 (s). The crystals were obtained as an acetone solvate, but the elemental analysis was accomplished after desolvation under vacuum.
